indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Number of knowledge and advocacy products (research / case studies, policy briefs, etc.) justifying and advocating the need of investment projects’ environmental and social impact assessment publicly available. 2. Number of EIA / IEE legal (decree) and regulatory documents (guidelines and manuals) improved and adopted by the GoL. 3. Number of guidelines for integrating social and environmental impact assessment and management into agriculture and forestry investment projects finalized and tested in practice. 4. Number of joint IPD-DESIA joint monitoring of problematic investment projects carried out. 5. Number of national and provincial staff with capacity conduct EIA review and monitoring of investment projects. 6. The members of mass organizations/civil society groups, including women organizations actively participating and / or promoting public involvement in ESIA processes.

baseline.comment: 1. 0 2. Original EIA legal (Decree, 2010) and regulatory framework (EIA / IEE guidelines) exist but they are not well developed. 3. 0 4. 1 5. 40 6. N/A

actual.comment: 1. 2 (IEE Ministerial Instruction and ESIA Ministerial Instruction products produced and distributed to 17 PONRE for their reference) 2. The E(S)IA Decree and all related EIA and IEE guidelines are widely disseminated to 17 provinces. 3. Not achieve yet 4. 0 (There is no joint monitoring due to the DESIA agreed with IPD to assess the result of the joint monitoring in order to improve procedure and effectives and efficiency of the joint monitoring activities. However round table meeting were conducted to discuss on any issues regarding to the joint monitoring) 5. Additional 248 (52 females) 6. 0 (No training on public involvement. First draft of public involvement video has been completed and under reviewing by the DEISA team)

1. 2 2. 4 3.0 4. 0 (There is no joint monitoring due to the DESIA agreed with IPD to assess the result of the joint monitoring in order to improve procedure and effectives and efficiency of the joint monitoring activities. However round table meeting were conducted to discuss on any issues regarding to the joint monitoring) 5. 88 (31 females) 6. 37 (33 females)

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Number of environmental economic evidence (financial analysis, economic studies, and policy briefs) produced and disseminated to support sustainable and equitable investments. 2. Number of key organizations (involved in decision making processes) participating in identification of research topics and at dissemination workshops. 3. Existence of Cross-sectoral collaboration mechanism to guide targeted environmental economics research. 4. Existence of training module and a manual on environmental economics introduced in MPI Economics and Planning Training Centre curricula and other academic/training institutes.

baseline.comment: 1. Few environmental economic report (Economic Valuation of Ecosystem Services and Poverty Alleviation) available to support sustainable and equitable investments. 2. Only a few key organisations (involved in decision making) are involved in identifying research topics or represented in NERI dissemination workshops. 3. Very few, if any, operational cross-sectoral collaboration mechanisms in environmental economics. 4. 0

target.comment: 1. 1 - Economic evidence produced and disseminated to technical groups and policy makers by competing one environmental economic research topics identified with corresponding literature reviews, meta-analysis, methodology, data sets collected and reports prepared on each research topic - including two policy briefs. Two mini grants approved with corresponding mini research reports. 2. 3 (MPI and NA and MoNRE) 3. Cross-sectoral collaboration mechanism (National Experts Group and Advisory Board) formulated and engaged in environmental economic research. 4. First draft of environmental economics training manual developed.

actual.comment: 1. Five Researches finalized which two of five were published: (I) Economic Valuation of Ecosystem Services and Poverty Alleviation: a Case Study on Land Use in Oudomxay Province; (ii) rubber concession in Lao PDR – an impact assessment for monitoring indicators; (iii) Final draft contract farming study report; (iv) final draft soil quality analysis report for the rubber plantation; (v) final draft gender role in the contract farming. 2. 3 3. Expert working group has been established to guide target environmental economic research. 4 team of expert working group are functioning and supporting the finalization of the contract farming study. 27 NERI staffs and expert members has strengthened research knowledge and skills through participating in the literature review training delivered by the PEI-NERI. 4. A Training module on the environmental economic valuation was completed and training was delivered to NERI staff, and to be published in early 2015.

target.comment: 1. 1 - Economic evidence produced and disseminated to technical groups and policy makers by competing one environmental economic research topics identified with corresponding literature reviews, meta-analysis, methodology, data sets collected and reports prepared on each research topic - including two policy briefs. Two mini grants approved with corresponding mini research reports. 2. 3 (MPI and NA and MoNRE) 3. Cross-sectoral collaboration mechanism (National Experts Group and Advisory Board) formulated and engaged in environmental economic research. 4. 2

actual.comment: 1. 23 - 1 research finalized (English version of contract farming study); 1 policy brief of contract farming; 1 ongoing research on impact of mining operation to the SME development in Lao PDR. 2. 3 (MPI, NA and MONRE). 3. 1 research advisory board and research team. 4. 2 (economic valuation and research methodology training modules)

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description:
Output 1: 1. Capacity development plan developed 2. At least 2 districts of the target provinces have completed Hazard Risk Vulnerability Assessments (HRVAs) 3. Clear mandate for integration of Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) in the sectoral plans of DRR focal points developed 4. Disaster law developed 5. Post Disaster Needs Assessment (PDNA) developed 6. Early Recovery Cluster functioned with defined roles, responsibilities and contingency plan.
Output 2: 1. Coordination capacity of Department of Disaster Management and Climate Change (DDMCC) improved 2. Number of Disaster Management Information System established at the centre and local levels 3. Number of effective end to end user early warning system established in close coordination with the HMD, Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment, MRC, WB/ADPC and based on the draft EWS strategy
Output 3: 1. Number of village level HRV assessment reports available

baseline.comment:
Output 1: 1. No [2013] 2. 0 [2013] 3. Legal Framework in the form of Prime Ministerial decree drafted not yet finalized, approved and implemented by the government 4. No [2013] 5. No [2013] 6. No [2013]
Output 2: 1. Insufficient [2013] 2. 0 3. 0
Output 3: 1. 0

target.comment:
Output 1: 1. A detailed capacity needs assessment and development plan developed 2. 2 districts in Sayyabouly and Xiengkhouang provinces 3. Capacity assessment and development plan conducted to inform the mandate of DDMCC 4. Draft disaster law developed (The disaster law is now called disaster and climate change law). Compilation and documentation of lessons learned on flood response and early recovery with special focus on women and other vulnerable groups conducted to inform disaster and climate change law 5. Provided input to develop PDNA 6. Yes
Output2: 1. Sufficient 2. 2 in Sayabouly and Xiengkhouang 3. 2 in Sayabouly and Xiengkhouang and at least 2 districts of each target provinces
Output 3: 1. 0

actual.comment:
Output 1: 1. A detailed capacity needs assessment and development plan developed in late 2014. 2. 6 gender sensitive HVCAs were carried out in 3 districts. (HRVA has changed the name to HVCA) 3. The mandate of DDMCC has been updated partly based on the capacity assessment and development plan 4. Draft disaster law is not yet developed. However, a study tour to Viet Nam was held to increase knowledge of Lao government officials in disaster legislation. 5. Input to PDNA was provided by UNDP and final PDNA is aimed to be finalized in 2015. 6. Yes
Output 2: 1. Sufficient (DDMCC is able to coordinate all stakeholders in response to disaster events). 2. 0 (Insufficient fund) 3. 0 (While awaiting for SOP from Metrology and Hydrology, the project conducted early warning system best practice)
Output 3: 1. 0

target.comment:
Output 1: 1. A detailed capacity needs assessment and development plan developed in 2014. Therefore, the target for this year is to implement the plan 2. 0 3. The mandate of DDMCC cleared and endorsed 4. Draft disaster law developed 5. PDNA finalized and trained 6. Yes
Output 2: 1. Sufficient 2. 1 (central level) 3. 0
Output 3: 1. 0

location.name: Laos
location.activity-description: This Project focuses on (1) lawmaking capacity of NA members and staff, (2) oversight role and institutional capacity of NA, and (3) people's participation in the decision making process. Main beneficiaries include NA members and staff, constituency offices at local level, and constituents in differ

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description:
Output 1
Indicator 1: Percentage of new NA Members (first time MNAs) that demonstrate basic skills in law making and review [using the law making manual from SPLSMP].
Indicator 2: Number of legislative briefs prepared and submitted by NA staff to the NA Committees and Members
Indicator 3: Percentage of NA Committees and Members making reference to the gender and social inclusion guidelines of the Law Making manual in their work
Output 2
Indicator 1: Number of selected NA and NA Constituency Office (NACO) staff (in 4 pilot COs) that demonstrate basic skills on research, policy analysis, archiving and data gathering techniques
Indicator 2: Number of legislative briefs submitted to NA Members by pilot constituency offices
Indicator 3: Percentage of recommendations based on the NA Capacity Development Plan including strengthening of the ICPMS unit pilot-tested
Indicator 4: Level of progress made in developing the parliamentary database (NA intranet)
*Scale of Progress from 0 to 3 points: 0 = No existing NA intranet or database in place; 1 = NA intranet/parliamentary database established; 2 = NA intranet improved and updated with selected NA staff including NACOs trained; 3 = 18 NACOs have stable ICT connection and regularly utilized the intranet for their legislation work
Output 3
Indicator 1: (i) Number of issues raised by constituents during fact-finding missions and public consultations conducted by NA Committees (ii) Percentage of constituents expressing satisfaction for the information they received during pilot public information events or "constituency office days" in selected provinces.
Indicator 2: Percentage of recommendations in the public consultation guidelines pilot-tested by the NA Committees.
Indicator 3: Level of progress in the development of an NA-stakeholders roadmap or guidelines for NA engagement with mass organizations, disadvantaged groups, NPAs and INGOs.
* Scale of Progress from 0 to 3 points: 0 = No roadmap or guidelines

baseline.comment:
Output 1
Baseline 1: 0% [Law making manual is being finalized and translated into Lao]
Baseline 2: 0 [Members of the NA received information papers prior to NA session. These information papers only provided general information and comparative examples of laws from other countries]
Baseline 3: 0% [No guidelines or mechanism to review gender and social inclusion issues in draft bills and amendments to the laws]
Output 2
Baseline 1: 0 [Most research, analyses and information gathering functions are delegated to the NA Secretariat Department and NA Information Center. Most NACO staff have limited skills in research, analysis and data gathering]
Baseline 2: 0 [There are no existing legislative briefs prepared and submitted to NA Members by constituency offices]
Baseline 3: 0 [Capacity assessment of the NA Members and staff including constituency offices was conducted and draft report is still being reviewed by the NA]
Baseline 4: 1 [NA intranet/parliamentary database established]
Output 3
Baseline 1: (i) 0 [NA does not have record the number of issues raised by the constituents during fact finding missions and public consultations (ii) 0% [NA constituency offices have not organized public information events or open days]
Baseline 2: 0 [ Public consultation guidelines are being revised and to be submitted to the NA for approval]
Baseline 3: 0 [No existing NA-stakeholders' roadmap or guidelines for NA engagement with mass organizations, disadvantaged groups, NPAs and INGOs]
Sub-output 3.1 Baseline 3.1 (i): NA website had 1 million visitors in 2014. (ii): 2 draft bills and adopted laws discussed in the conduct of outreach missions and public consultations.
Sub-output 3.2 Baseline 3.2: 0 [No existing constituents’ reports prepared by the communities or citizens]
Sub-output 3.3 Baseline 3.3: 0% [In 2015, NA assessment on public engagement tools was conducted with recommendations on how to further improve them]
Sub-output 3.4 Baseline 3.4: 15% of the petit

target.comment:
Given that the Project was launched only in July 2014, most targets for these indicators were not set.
Output 1
Target 1: No target is set for this indicator in 2014 and 2015, as new NA Members will assume their duties in mid-2016. Target 2: No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015. Target 3: No targets were set for 2014, as the law-making manual was to be developed in 2015.
Output 2
Target 1: No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015. Target 2: No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015. Target 3: No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015. Target 4: No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015 or 2016.
Output 3
Target 1: (i) No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015. (ii) No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015. Target 2: No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015. Target 3: 1 = Draft roadmap or guidelines on NA-CSO engagement
Sub-output 3.1 Target 3.1.1: (i) No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015. (ii): No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015.
Sub-output 3.2 Target 3.2.1: No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015
Sub-output 3.3 Target 3.3.1: No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015
Sub-output 3.4 Target 3.4.1: No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015
Sub-output 3.5 Target 3.5.1: No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015

actual.comment:
Output 1
Target 1: No targets were set for 2014, as the law-making manual was to be developed in 2015 and new NA Members will assume their duties in mid-2016. Target 2: No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015. Target 3: No targets were set for 2014, as the law-making manual was to be developed in 2015.
Output 2
Target 1: No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015. Target 2: No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015 Target 3: No targets were set for 2014, as the NA Capacity Development Plan was yet to be finalized Target 4: No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015 or 2016.
Output 3
Target 1: (i) No targets were set for 2014, as the website was going to be improved in 2015. (ii) No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start either in 2015 or 2016. Target 2: No targets were set for 2014, as the public consultation guidelines were to be developed in 2015. Target 3: Achieved. The draft guidelines on NA-CSO engagement was developed. Target 4: No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015 or 2016. Target 5: No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015 or 2016. Target 6: No targets were set for 2014, as the public engagement tools assessment will be conducted in 2015. Target 7: No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015 or 2016. Target 8: No targets were set for 2014, as the project support will start in 2015 or 2016.

target.comment:
Please note that the 2014 Indicators were fine-tuned in 2015 based on the first year project evaluation‘s recommendation to review and identify appropriate Indicators for the NASSP RRF. A revised set of Indicators and targets were proposed from October 2015 until December 2016.
Output 1
Target 1: 50% of new NA Members (first time MNAs) have improved skills on law making and review [using the law making manual from SPLSMP] Target 2: 2 legislative briefs [including a briefer on the 8th NSEDP] prepared and submitted by the NA staff to the NA Committees and Members Target 3: 20% of NA Committees and Members making reference to the gender and social inclusion guidelines of the Law Making manual in their work
Output 2
Target 1: 10 NA and NACO staff demonstrate basic skills on research, policy analysis, archiving and data gathering techniques. Target 2: 4 legislative briefs produced and submitted by pilot constituency offices to NA Members Target 3: 50% of the recommendations from the NA Capacity Development Plan pilot-tested Target 4: 2 [ NA intranet improved and updated with selected NA staff including NACOs trained]
Output 3
Target 1: (i) 8 issues raised by constituents during fact-finding missions and public consultations conducted of NA Committees (ii) 75% of constituents expressing satisfaction for the information they received during pilot public information events or "constituency office days" in selected provinces Target 2: 50% of recommendations in the public consultation guidelines pilot-tested by NA Committees Target 3: 3 = Final draft of the roadmap ready for NA endorsement or approval
Sub-output 3.1 Target 3.1: 20% increase in the number of visitors to the NA website
Sub-output 3.2 Target 3.2: 80-90% of the findings and recommendations from constituents’ reports are used in the preparation of legislative briefers for NA Members [in pilot NACOS].
Sub-output 3.3 Target 3.3: 80-90% of recommendations from the NA assessment on public engageme

actual.comment:
Please note that the 2014 Indicators were fine-tuned in 2015 based on the first year project evaluation‘s recommendation to review and identify appropriate Indicators for the NASSP RRF. A revised set of Indicators and targets were proposed from October 2015 until December 2016.
Output 1
Result 1.1: 0% Result 1.2: 0 Result 1.3: 0%

iati-activity.title: Strengthening Legal and Institutional Frameworks
iati-activity.description: GPAR SLIFEPA is to strengthen the legal and institutional frameworks for effective public administration (national and local) and improved service delivery. It is being implemented in alignment with other projects of the National GPAR Programme.

iati-activity.title: Strengthening Legal and Instit
iati-activity.description: GPAR SLIFEPA enables MOHA in setting in place more effective public administration across the respective tiers of government whilst ensuring the rights of individuals vis a vis the administrative system of Lao PDR.

location.activity-description:
Output 1: Support for drafting public administration laws, decrees and regulations to enable improved public service delivery
Most activities (unless specified otherwise) are planned to be implemented in all provinces and Vientiane Capital.

location.name: Vientiane
location.activity-description:
Output2. Strengthening capacity in MoHA to effectively coordinate and monitor the implementation of the GPAR programme and related activities
The Project plans to organize a training to some DOHA staff in all provinces.
